oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Saint Peter Primitive Baptist Church: Sterling Jubilees article
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Birmingham Quartet Scrapbook: A Quartet Reunion in Jefferson County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: C.I.O. Singers, Bessemer, Jefferson County, AL
Short entry on the Sterling Jubilees, an African American a capella group associated with Saint Peter Primitive Baptist Church.

St. Peter Primitive Baptist Church, constructed in 1943 with a congregation dating to 1903, is locally significant for its association with the Alabama Christian Movement for Human Rights and the Civil Rights Movement in Birmingham from 1956 to 1958. It is also associated with African American a capella gospel singing and as a significant example of mid-twentieth century Gothic Revival design in an Alabama African-American church.
